top_categories.workout_context: Racing Nova Eroica isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Nova Eroica’s tuscan strade bianche (white roads) (70%), paved roads (30%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Nova Eroica rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Nova Eroica when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Nova Eroica’s tuscan strade bianche—rolling white gravel roads and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Nova Eroica. Make this intensity feel like home.
At 84 miles, Nova Eroica punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Nova Eroica’s 9,186ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Nova Eroica — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Nova Eroica — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on tuscan strade bianche—rolling white gravel roads.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Nova Eroica’s tuscan strade bianche—rolling white gravel roads delivers on race day.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Nova Eroica’s 9,186ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Nova Eroica’s 84 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Nova Eroica requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on tuscan strade bianche—rolling white gravel roads to build confidence. Expect: tuscan strade bianche (white roads) (70%), paved roads (30%), rolling tuscan hills.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Gravel Specific, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 84 miles of tuscan strade bianche—rolling white gravel roads in Buonconvento, Tuscany, Italy.
